Posts.Content: Sep 2, 2012 09:04AM lamb wrote: Is the reason cancer risk increases with dense breasts because mammo don't detect the cancer or is it because there is more tissue that the cancer can form in.
Posts.Title: Dense Breast Tissue Reminder Aug242007 Shar1

Posts.Content: Oct 27, 2012 09:10PM - edited Oct 27, 2012 09:12PM by lamb I am going through the same think. I had a lumpectomy two months ago- and at the hospital where the surgury was done adh was seen. At that time my BS sent my slides for a second look. This time FEA was found. Which from talking to my doctors means my risk is only minimally increased. Went to an oncologist and he sent them to a third pathogist. Where no atypia was seen. The 2nd a d third were from breast pathologist so from what I am told they r the experts. I go back next month to talk to the MO I think just closer monitoring is what I am going to be told. Sure hope so. A third opinion doesn't hurt.
Posts.Title: Pathology report for adh Peroper13 Peroper13

Posts.Content: Aug 28, 2012 12:25PM lamb wrote: It's two weeks today since I had my lumpectomy. Areas taken out of both breasts. Right side is still sore. Never any terrible pain. One minute you are looking at them Hooking you up to monitors and the next thing you know it is over. Not too bad all.
